H0.text: Which body of water was previously called the Euxine, after early colonisation of its southern coastline by Greeks, derived from their word for 'hospitable'. Black Sea

H1.text: Which body of water was previously called the Euxine, after early colonisation of its southern coastline by Greeks, derived from their word for 'hospitable'. Caspian Sea

H2.text: Which body of water was previously called the Euxine, after early colonisation of its southern coastline by Greeks, derived from their word for 'hospitable'. Aegean Sea

H3.text: Which body of water was previously called the Euxine, after early colonisation of its southern coastline by Greeks, derived from their word for 'hospitable'. Euxine

A4.text: In Greece, the historical name 'Euxine Sea', which holds a different literal meaning (see below), is still widely used:
